abstract: German police will increase security in Heidenau, town near Dresden, after two nights of sometimes violent protests by right-wing extremists outside refugee shelter; incident highlights tensions as country struggles to absorb wave of people seeking asylum.
lead_paragraph: Protests by right-wing groups against the growing number of refugees in the small town of Heidenau outside Dresden grew violent at times over the weekend.

headline.main: German Town to Add Security After Anti-Refugee Protests
headline.print_headline: German Town to Add Security After Protests

snippet: Protests by right-wing groups against the growing number of refugees in the small town of Heidenau outside Dresden grew violent at times over the weekend.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
